cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving NNW, forecast to turn NW and then WNW across the central Gulf, aiming for the north-western Gulf Coast (Louisiana/Texas border area) by late Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (north-western Gulf Coast) near or just east of the TX-LA border

weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-western Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward across coastal Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (34–50 kt) possible Tuesday, highest risk Tuesday afternoon–night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Offshore wind direction if center lands east of Galveston keeps surge below 3 ft; only minor coastal flooding possible
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could produce 1–3 in., isolated 4 in.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Patchy coastal inundation and elevated seas may disrupt vessel scheduling and pilot transfers
